question: Which among the following is true?
option1: the gold coins issued by Guptas were having more Gold Content than Kushanas
option2: The gold coins issued by Kushana were having more Gold content than Guptas
option3: Both were having the same fraction of Gold
answer: The gold coins issued by Kushana were having more Gold content than Guptas
explanation: According to the Indian Archaeology, the gold coins were issued by different emperors. Kushanas issued gold coins that were being used to make trade relation easier. The Gupta emperors made the most aristocratic gold coins. The gold coins of Gupta rulers were better than Kushana rulers because Gupta used good quality gold for the coins. This indicates that Gupta coins were more expensive and high quality.
